questions.question: I have a solution to ……………………………. problem.
questions.description: Before a noun, use the possessive form of the pronoun.

questions.question: She has never thanked ………………………….. for anything.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: I don’t know how she spends ………………………….. time.
questions.description: Use the possessive form of the pronoun before a noun.

questions.question: They asked her what ……………………………. was doing there.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of the verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: She looked at ………………………………… angrily.
questions.description: Object forms of pronouns are used after prepositions.

questions.question: We have invited all the friends ……………………………… have.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of the verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: They organized a small party for ……………………………… friends.
She asked me what …………………………….. was looking for.
No one loves …………………………….. more than my mother.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of the verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: I love him more than ……………………………
questions.description: The subject and object form of you is the same - you.
